alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 5:46AM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky, southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Boyd, Carter and Lawrence. In southeast Ohio, Lawrence. In West Virginia, Boone, Cabell, Kanawha, Lincoln, Mason, Putnam and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated rain has diminished across the warned area but runoff from earlier rains is likely resulting in some flooding of secondary roads. - Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charleston, Huntington, Nitro, Louisa, Winfield, Wayne, Hamlin, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Barboursville, Sissonville and Milton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
